summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) staff regarding an application to share additional trust and will documents received from Jeffrey Epstein's estate attorneys. The correspondence involves coordinating review of the materials and the sharing order.

events.title: Receipt of Epstein Estate Documents
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York received additional trust and will documents from Jeffrey Epstein's estate attorneys over a two-week period.

events.title: Sharing Order Application Update
events.description: A prosecutor updated a sharing order application to include the newly received trust and will documents from Epstein's estate, requesting review from a colleague.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively handling Epstein-related estate documents as of January 2020.
The office received additional trust and will documents from Epstein's estate attorneys over a two-week period prior to January 29, 2020.
Prosecutors were preparing a sharing order application to distribute these newly received estate documents.
The email shows coordination between prosecutors regarding the accurate characterization of the estate materials for legal purposes.
